name: Free Quran API (90+ languages)

alignment.comment: Global, no-auth access to Qur'an text/translations directly serves Islamic education and public benefit.

openness.comment: Explicit Unlicense (public domain) with LICENSE file. Maximally permissive for reuse and research.

liveness.comment: Active issues and commits through 2025; CDN JSON versioning in use; no tagged releases.

value.comment: High-impact, multilingual corpus via a simple REST shape that's easy to integrate for apps and teaching.

docs.comment: README covers endpoints, versioning, and fallbacks; an OpenAPI spec and richer docs site would help.

community.comment: CONTRIBUTING present; benefit from issue/PR templates, labels, and a short governance note for new editions.

ethics.comment: Clearly faith-aligned and beneficial, with references and attribution guidance.

summary: A widely reused, truly open Qur'an API (Unlicense) serving 90+ languages and 400+ translations. Its CDN-first JSON design makes integration trivial and resilient for educational and production use.
narrative: The project distributes Qur'an data via jsDelivr with a clear REST-like URL pattern, enabling developers and educators to fetch chapters, verses, info, and fonts without authentication or rate limits.
Breadth matters here: 90+ languages and 400+ translations make this API a unique public resource for the global Muslim community.
Formalizing an OpenAPI spec, lightweight governance (how editions are vetted/updated), and a periodic changelog would make downstream adoption even smoother.
recommendations: Publish an OpenAPI (Swagger) spec and link it from the README.
Add issue/PR templates, labels, and a brief governance note (edition criteria and update flow).
Provide a periodic CHANGELOG and consider semantic tags for data snapshots.
